cz.muni.fi.virtualtoolmanager.pubapi.entities

Class PhysicalMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.muni.fi.virtualtoolmanager.pubapi.entities.PhysicalMachine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<PhysicalMachine>

    public final class PhysicalMachine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<PhysicalMachine>
    Class that is generaly used for connection purposes, because contains information which are needed to perform connection operation and so access virtual machines which are present on a particular physical machine.
    Also for the physical machine holds it represents a host machine on which web server of VirtualBox should be running in order to be able to control its virtual machines remotely.
    See Also:
    ConnectionManager, ConnectionManagerImpl, VirtualizationToolManagerImpl, SearchManagerImpl, VirtualMachineManagerImpl, VirtualMachine

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicalMachine

        public PhysicalMachine(java.lang.String addressIP,
                       java.lang.String websrvPort,
                       java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String userPassword)
        The first and the only constructor of class PhysicalMachine. To ensure successful creation of an object of class PhysicalMachine it is needed to pass to the constructor strings with physical machine IP address and VirtualBox web server port number that are not null nor empty. Username and user password can be passed as a null or empty strings. There can be thrown following exceptions:
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when a null or empty string value of physical machine IP address or VirtualBox web server port number are passed to the constructor.
        Parameters:
        addressIP - represents IP address of physical machine
        websrvPort - represents port number of VirtualBox web server
        username - represents username of user account under which the remote VirtualBox web server is running
        userPassword - represents user password of user account under which the remote VirtualBox web server is running

    • Method Detail

      • getAddressIP

        public java.lang.String getAddressIP()
        Gets the physical machine IP address.
        Returns:
        IP address of the physical machine as string

      • getPortOfVTWebServer

        public java.lang.String getPortOfVTWebServer()
        Gets the port number on which the VirtualBox web server is running. *
        Returns:
        VirtualBox web server port as string

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Gets the username of the user account under which the VirtualBox web server is running on the remote physical machine and which is used for authentication while the connection establishment is being processed.
        Returns:
        username as string

      • getUserPassword

        public java.lang.String getUserPassword()
        Gets the user password of the user account under which the VirtualBox web server is running on the remote physical machine and which is used for authentication while the connection establishment is being processed.
        Returns:
        user password as string

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        This method is used for check if this physical machine is same as another physical machine. Comparison is performed according to all physical machine properties - IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username and user password.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - represents physical machine instance which is going to be compared with this physical machine
        Returns:
        true if the objects are same, false otherwise

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method is used to print information about this physical machine to string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string in form "[Physical machine: IP address=<ipaddress>, VT web server port=<websrvport>, username=<username>, user password=<userpassword>]"

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(PhysicalMachine pm)
        Method used to compare two physical machines - this with another - in order to sort (order) physical machines. For comparison are used all physical machine properties.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<PhysicalMachine>
        Parameters:
        pm - represents physical machine with which is this one compared
        Returns:
        -1 if this physical machine is less than another one, 0if this physical machine is equal to another one, 1if this physical machine is greater than another one
